past_simple_active.english: He called you an hour ago.
They traveled to Spain last year.
past_simple_active.russian: Они путешествовали в Испанию в прошлом году.

past_simple_active.english: We were late for the meeting.
What did you do last weekend?
past_simple_active.russian: Что ты делал в прошлые выходные?

past_simple_passive.english: The letter was sent yesterday.
The house was built in 1990.
The window was broken.
I was invited to the party.
We were asked to help.
The car was stolen last night.
The book was written by a famous author.
English was spoken everywhere.
The decision was made quickly.
The keys were found in the kitchen.
The movie was directed by Steven Spielberg.
My wallet wasn't (was not) stolen.
Were you born in this city?
When was the computer repaired?
How much money was saved?
The problem wasn't solved.
The children were taken to school.
This song was heard all summer.
The news was announced in the morning.
The streets were decorated for the holiday.

future_simple_passive.english: The documents will be signed tomorrow.
You will be contacted soon.
future_simple_passive.russian: С вами свяжутся в ближайшее время.

future_simple_passive.english: The results will be announced next week.
future_simple_passive.russian: Результаты будут объявлены на следующей неделе.

future_simple_passive.english: A new park will be built here.
Dinner will be served at 7 PM.
I will be met at the airport.
The problem will be solved.
All employees will be informed.
The car will be repaired by Friday.
This song will be heard everywhere.
The house will be sold.
The meeting will be held online.
The goods will be delivered to your door.
future_simple_passive.russian: Товары будут доставлены к вашей двери.

future_simple_passive.english: A decision will be made by the end of the day.
future_simple_passive.russian: Решение будет принято к концу дня.

future_simple_passive.english: He will be elected as the new manager.
The old rules will be cancelled.
The report won't (will not) be finished today.
Will the package be sent today?
When will the project be completed?
How will the payment be received?

past_continuous_active.english: I was working at 6 PM yesterday.
She was studying when I called.
We were watching TV all evening.
They were traveling around Italy last summer.
past_continuous_active.russian: Они путешествовали по Италии прошлым летом.

past_continuous_active.english: He was cooking dinner while she was setting the table.
past_continuous_active.russian: Он готовил ужин, пока она накрывала на стол.

past_continuous_active.english: It was raining when we left the house.
past_continuous_active.russian: Шёл дождь, когда мы вышли из дома.

past_continuous_active.english: I wasn't sleeping at that time.
past_continuous_active.russian: Я не спал в то время.

past_continuous_active.english: What were you doing at the moment of the accident?
past_continuous_active.russian: Что ты делал в момент аварии?

past_continuous_passive.english: The road was being repaired all week.
A new bridge was being built when I visited the city.
past_continuous_passive.russian: Новый мост строили, когда я посещал город.

past_continuous_passive.english: My computer was being fixed yesterday afternoon.
past_continuous_passive.russian: Мой компьютер вчера после обеда чинили.

past_continuous_passive.english: The documents were being prepared for the meeting.
Dinner was being served when we arrived.

past_perfect_active.english: I had finished my work before they came.
past_perfect_active.russian: Я закончил свою работу до того, как они пришли.

past_perfect_active.english: She had already left when I called.
past_perfect_active.russian: Она уже ушла, когда я позвонил.

past_perfect_active.english: We realized we had lost the keys.
He had never seen such a beautiful place before.
past_perfect_active.russian: Он никогда раньше не видел такого красивого места.

past_perfect_active.english: After they had eaten, they went for a walk.
past_perfect_active.russian: После того как они поели, они пошли гулять.

past_perfect_passive.english: The letter had been sent before we found the mistake.
past_perfect_passive.russian: Письмо было отправлено до того, как мы нашли ошибку.

past_perfect_passive.english: The car had been repaired by the end of the day.
past_perfect_passive.russian: Машина была отремонтирована к концу дня.

past_perfect_passive.english: He was upset because his idea hadn't been accepted.
past_perfect_passive.russian: Он был расстроен, потому что его идея не была принята.

past_perfect_passive.english: Had the room been cleaned before the guests arrived?
past_perfect_passive.russian: Комната была убрана до прихода гостей?

past_perfect_passive.english: All the tickets had been sold by the time we got there.
past_perfect_passive.russian: Все билеты были проданы к тому времени, как мы туда добрались.

past_perfect_continuous_active.english: I had been working for 10 hours when you called.
past_perfect_continuous_active.russian: Я проработал уже 10 часов, когда ты позвонил.

past_perfect_continuous_active.english: She was tired because she had been studying all day.
past_perfect_continuous_active.russian: Она устала, потому что училась весь день.

past_perfect_continuous_active.english: They had been waiting for over an hour before the bus finally came.
past_perfect_continuous_active.russian: Они ждали больше часа, прежде чем автобус наконец приехал.

past_perfect_continuous_active.english: How long had you been living there before you moved?
past_perfect_continuous_active.russian: Как долго ты там жил, прежде чем переехал?

past_perfect_continuous_active.english: His eyes were red. He had been crying.
past_perfect_continuous_active.russian: Его глаза были красными. Он плакал.

future_simple_active.english: They will help us with the project.

future_continuous_active.english: At this time tomorrow, I will be flying to London.
future_continuous_active.russian: В это же время завтра я буду лететь в Лондон.

future_continuous_active.english: Don't call between 6 and 8, we will be having dinner.
future_continuous_active.russian: Не звони между 6 и 8, мы будем ужинать.

future_continuous_active.english: This time next week, she will be starting her new job.
future_continuous_active.russian: В это же время на следующей неделе она будет начинать свою новую работу.

future_continuous_active.english: Will you be using the car tonight?
future_continuous_active.russian: Ты будешь пользоваться машиной сегодня вечером?

future_continuous_active.english: I won't be working next Friday.
future_continuous_active.russian: Я не буду работать в следующую пятницу.

future_perfect_active.english: By next year, I will have finished my degree.
future_perfect_active.russian: К следующему году я закончу свою степень.

future_perfect_active.english: They will have built the house by summer.
She will have left by the time you get there.
future_perfect_active.russian: Она уже уедет к тому времени, как ты туда доберёшься.

future_perfect_active.english: Will you have saved enough money by December?
future_perfect_active.russian: Ты накопишь достаточно денег к декабрю?

future_perfect_active.english: We won't have completed the report by Friday.
future_perfect_active.russian: Мы не завершим отчёт к пятнице.

future_perfect_passive.english: The new stadium will have been built by the start of the championship.
future_perfect_passive.russian: Новый стадион будет построен к началу чемпионата.

future_perfect_passive.english: All the invitations will have been sent out by tomorrow.
future_perfect_passive.russian: Все приглашения будут разосланы к завтрашнему дню.

future_perfect_passive.english: Will the preparations have been finished by noon?
The decision will have been made by the board before the meeting.
future_perfect_passive.russian: Решение будет принято советом до собрания.

future_perfect_continuous_active.english: By the end of this month, I will have been working here for 5 years.
future_perfect_continuous_active.russian: К концу этого месяца я буду работать здесь уже 5 лет.

future_perfect_continuous_active.english: In July, they will have been living in Paris for a decade.
future_perfect_continuous_active.russian: В июле они будут жить в Париже уже десятилетие.

future_perfect_continuous_active.english: She will have been studying English for 10 hours by tonight.
future_perfect_continuous_active.russian: К сегодняшнему вечеру она будет учить английский уже 10 часов.

future_perfect_continuous_active.english: How long will you have been driving when we arrive?
future_perfect_continuous_active.russian: Сколько ты уже будешь за рулём, когда мы приедем?
